From augmented reality filters to personalised Bitmoji, Snapchat has a range of fun and quirky features for users to enjoy.

Now, the photo messaging app has launched a new feature called 3D paint, which allows users to draw on their face in 3D.

A statement explained: “Today, Snapchat are launching 3D Paint - a new super simple, quick and fun way to overlay colourful 3D drawings on your face and the world around you, directly from the Snapchat camera.”

Users can choose from a range of 3D paint features, including rainbow effects, neon stripes or even comedy moustaches.

Unfortunately for Android users, the feature is currently only available on iPhone , for those users running at least iOS 8.

Snapchat says that it will be available on Android ‘in the next few months.’

(Image: Snapchat)

(Image: Snapchat)

How to 3D Paint on Snapchat

1. Make sure you’ve updated your iPhone to run iOS 8+ and that you’ve updated the Snapchat app

2. Open the Snapchat camera, then select the icon to the right of the camera button

3. Choose ‘Create’ and the carousel will load

4. Find the 3D Paint feature and start creating your masterpiece!
